status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

fields.summary: Forward-slash characters are not allowed in key pairs and trigger HTTP 500

comments.body:
use 3.4 console regex, but allow up to 255 chars as the euca limit now matches the aws limit.
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/blob/maint/3.4/testing/static/js/support.js#L43

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1222
Punted to 4.1.1 due to regression potential of PR 1222
[~scottb]: We'll need to add this to the known issues list for 4.1.0
Added to 4.1 KI list: "Using non-Latin characters in some object names can trigger an HTTP 500 error. Workaround: avoid using non-Latin characters in resource names."
Updated PR against master is at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1269

[~alice], [~dkavanagh]: There's some confusion in this ticket.  The fix in PR 1269 doesn't align with the ticket description or the fixVersion, so let's re-target this ticket to 4.2 and leave GUI-1568 to handle the case for 4.1.1, right?
[~kgill] GUI-1568 looks almost identical to this one. What was fixed in this ticket, that's different?  I'm OK with re-targeting.

[~alice]: Yeah, the descriptions in the two tickets are almost identical, but the fix for 1524 allows '/' characters in the key pair name, while 1568 includes various unicode fixes.  Since 1524 is a corner case, we opted to punt that to 4.2 (and looks as though we forgot to update the fixVersion here).
[~kgill], I see now. Can we change the fix version, then to 4.2? Maybe we could also change the ticket name to reflect the nature of the fix?

[~alice]: This issue seems to have been resolved by the fixed for GUI-1568, looking at the latest 4.1 branch.  Could you confirm?

Heads up [~scottb] that we can probably remove GUI-1524 from the KI list for 4.1.1.

/cc [~jloza]

Sorry for the confusion, GUI-1524 is distinct from GUI-1568 since the fix for GUI-1524 allows key pairs to contain forward slashes.  So to clarify a bit here... in 4.1.1 we are *not* allowing key pairs to contain slashes, but In 4.2 we will allow key pairs to contain forward slashes.  As GUI-1524 is written, I wouldn't mark it as a know issue for 4.1.1 since entering a key pair with a forward slash will not return a 500 error.  And we can leave GUI-1524 open for 4.2 (although perhaps we should change the title to read "Allow key pairs to contain forward slashes"

/cc [~scottb], [~jloza], [~alice]
